intro: Microstylis guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan microstylis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a component of tropical biodiversity and its potential ecological interactions.
